newsitem.title: USA: U.S.,China textile talks going well -- Barshefsky.
newsitem.headline: U.S.,China textile talks going well -- Barshefsky.

text.p: Current textile negotiations between the United States and China are proceeding "fairly well," U.S. Trade Representative nominee, Charlene Barshefsky said Wednesday.

"The textile negotiations are proceeding fairly well, I received a report early this morning that indicated that both sides were very intensively in discussions," she told reporters after a Senate Finance Committee hearing on her nomination.

The United States is concerned about "Chinese circumvention of our textile quotas, and we're concerned also about U.S. textile producer market access into China," Barshefsky said. Both of those issues would need to be resolved in the new agreement, she added.

Asked about the U.S. trade deficit with Japan, Barshefsky said that while it has declined in recent years she would be on the lookout for any large uptick in Japanese exports to the United States, such as autos.

"If I look at the data in the last few months of 1996, the question arises whether we're going to see an upsurge again in Japanese exports to the United States, in the auto sector for example, and in other sectors," she said.

"I don't yet know what the trend will be but it's something that we want to keep an eye on and we want to be sure if there is any uptick it is not because of either new, or the persistence of old, market access barriers," she said.
